However, when you buy something through our retail links, we may earn an affiliate commission.This is Highly Recommend, a column dedicated to our very opinionated editors’ favorite things to eat, drink, and buy.Last spring, for the first time since I scored a single in college, I found myself living alone. It was amazing and a little weird to move into a clean-slate apartment with no roommate, no partner, just me, myself, and way too many houseplants. To make the place feel like home, I knew I had to cook. And to cook, I needed spices.I’d left my old jars behind because they were, well, old. Luckily I was given the Spicewalla kitchen essentials collection at just the right time. As promised, the spice collection includes all the essentials—which, turns out, is exactly the same lineup that Carla Lalli Music recommends in her cookbook, Where Cooking Begins.The spices were fresher than I knew spices could be: the cinnamon was spicy and potent, the crushed red pepper flakes were full of heat, and the whole cumin seeds were super fragrant. They come in small containers, which is a good thing because I know I’ll use them before they get dusty. And, at $95 for 18 high-quality containers, this spice collection is an investment I’m happy to make once a year to keep my home-cooked meals tasting fresh.
